byline.contributor: Mitch Smith reported from Cleveland, and Matt Apuzzo from Washington. Rodney Bengston contributed reporting from Cleveland.
byline.original: By MITCH SMITH and MATT APUZZO

abstract: Officials say Cleveland police department has agreed to adhere to some of most stringent standards in country over how and when its officers can use force, and will allow Justice Dept overview to ensure rules are not ignored; city's police department has become associated with racially charged debate over police tactics.
lead_paragraph: The Cleveland police department has agreed to follow some of the most exacting standards in the nation over how and when its officers can use force, part of a settlement with the Justice Department.

headline.main: Police in Cleveland Accept Tough Standards on Force
